intro: Cremanthodium nakaoi, commonly known as the Nakao's cremanthodium, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that help reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
